quest.name: The Lominsan Way
journal: Trachtoum remains unconvinced of your readiness to defeat the dread primal Tidus.

Your conversation with Trachtoum is interrupted by an irate miller, who accuses the flustered marauder of shirking his duty. As you look on in stunned silence, Trachtoum claims to have slain the goobbue that you but recently dispatched. Unconvinced, the miller decides that the truth will be revealed “the Lominsan way.” Speak with the miller outside and discover what this entails.

After besting Trachtoum in a boulder-breaking contest, you discover that the marauder was never a member of the Company of Heroes. However, he tells you that one of the Company's former captains now works at Costa del Sol. Journey to the resort and beg the veteran's assistance.

While Wheiskaet acknowledges your passion, he is reluctant to send an adventurer of unknown character to herhis death. If you wish to learn how the Company of Heroes defeated Titan, you must yet again prove yourself by completing Wheiskaet's challenges.
objectives: Speak with Wheiskaet in Costa del Sol.

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: So, uh...as I was sayin', I still don't know if ye've got what it takes to face Tidus. Maybe if ye slew a─

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text: Trachtoum? You in here drinking again? If you are, that goobbue had better be dead!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Oh, it's dead, chief, ye have me word on that! Cleaved the beast's skull in two with me trusty axe, I did!

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text: Is that a fact? And what will your friend here say if I ask herhim?

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Sh-She'llH-He'll vouch for me, of course! Ain't that right...friend?

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text: Tell me true: was it Trachtoum who slew that goobbue...or was it you?

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Chief! Wh-What are ye sayin'!? It's me, Trachtoum, the finest axeman ever to serve in the Company of Heroes, the legendary mercenaries who slew that bastard Tidus!

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text: ...Tidus? Tidus? Who in the seven hells is Tidus!? Some primal you fought in a drink-sodden dream? The Company of Heroes slew Titan, you bloody half-wit!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Ah. Aye, well...see, Tidus was what me an' the lads used to call him.

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text:
That's the biggest load of Sahagin shite I've ever heard.
Both of you, outside! We'll learn the truth the Lominsan way!

dialogue.name: NPC1
dialogue.text: Trachtoum─if you didn't slay that goobbue, you may consider your contract revoked!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: All right, all right, I admit it! I lied about bein' in the Company of Heroes. But I'm beggin' ye, chief─please don't dismiss me! I've learned me lesson, honest I have!

dialogue.name: NPC
dialogue.text: Save your blubbering, Trachtoum. <sigh> Gods, I should've known...

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Mercy, please! I didn't want to deceive ye, I swear! It's just that I kept gettin' turned away by all the folk I asked for work, an' I panicked!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: See, the last job I had was at Costa del Sol, an' there was this grizzled marauder everyone treated like royalty. When I heard he was a captain in the Company of Heroes, I finally understood why.

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: I-I wasn't bein' serious when I said I was one of 'em! But ye went an' believed me, so I...so I, er...

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: L-Look─his name was Wheiskaet, all right!? Wheiskaet! He'll tell ye how to defeat Titus or whatever the hells that thing's name is!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: That's what ye wanted, ain't it!? So come on, then! Tell the chief to forgive me! It's only fair!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Pardon? You wish to slay the Lord of Crags?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We must slay him, Captain. The people of Limsa Lominsa are depending upon us.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Hmph. You fancy yourselves heroes, then─just like in the tales?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Be not so quick to judge. Long have I labored for the well-being of you and yours. And my associate here has bathed in Ifrit's hellfire and lived.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: SheHe is blessed with a power that protects herhim from primal influence. Thus was shehe able to lay low the Lord of the Inferno.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We know full well the risks, and have taken every possible precaution. We lack only the knowledge of how to enter Titan's lair. Pray be so good as to grant us the boon of your wisdom, and we shall be on our way.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: A womanman who can't be tempered? Useful...but it will not be enough.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: It is true that the Company of Heroes fought and felled primals─but each victory was bought with the lifeblood of brave men and women.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: And Titan was the worst we faced. Aye, we defeated him─in the end─but he took from us some of our very best.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Even if you possess the power you claim, I have no reason to believe you will succeed.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Believe what you will. We mean to try.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though our lives be forfeit, we will not abandon Limsa to the wrath of Titan.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: You are passionate, I'll grant you that...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: ...And you deserved better than the greeting I gave you. But I will not send you into O'Ghomoro on a whim. To be plain, I do not wish to see you give your lives in vain.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: At the very least, I must have assurances that you are more than common adventurers.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I oversee security for Master Gegeruju's estates. Perhaps you can demonstrate your abilities by attending to one of our─

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ye gods, man─have you heard nothing I have said? We have not the time to perform trivial tasks. The enemy is at the gates!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Do you imagine words can sway me, girl?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: If you dislike my conditions, then you are welcome to find your own way into O'Ghomoro.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Though it pains me to admit it, I fear we have no choice but to acquiesce to the man's demands.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yet much remains to be done if we are to best Titan. Forgive me, but I must ask you to undertake this task alone. I will use the time to see to the remaining preparations.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Leaving the dirty work to others, are we? Heh, very well.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Pray do whatever the good captain bids...however trifling. Remember: the fate of Limsa Lominsa hangs in the balance.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Destroy the large boulder!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: All right─ye know the rules! First oneman to smash theirhis boulder will be judged the goobbue slayer!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: An' don't even think about tryin' to kill me! That's cheatin'!

dialogue.name: WINDMILGUARD
dialogue.text:
Who picked these boulders!? They're nothing alike!
Ah, the hells with it─let the contest begin!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: How ye doin', lassmatey? Feelin' a bit stiff, by any chance?

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Heh heh...only killin's against the rules!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Y-Yer still at it!? Bugger me─'tis lucky I've got one of these!

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Me arms, me bleedin' arms...

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Ack...ye rotten, stinkin' pile of...goobbue shite!
